self.title: CDISC Protocol Randomization Type Response Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to the types of randomization schemas associated with a randomized controlled trial.
name: Randomization Type Value Set
preferredTerm: CDISC Protocol Randomization Type Response Terminology

terms.definition: A type of randomization schema in which the group assignment probability of a participant is adjusted based on the group assignments of those participants already randomized in the trial.
A type of adaptive randomization in which a pre-specified number of participants is assigned to a block containing the same pre-specified number of balanced group assignments in random order.

A type of adaptive randomization in which the participant is assigned to the treatment group in an attempt to minimize imbalances in the number of participants for each stratification covariate across treatment groups.
A type of randomization schema in which each participant has the same chance of being randomized into any one group as all other participants.
A type of block randomization in which participants are stratified into groups based on prognostic variables and then randomized into balanced treatment groups.
A type of randomization schema in which unequal numbers of participants are purposely assigned to multiple treatment groups.
